name: VERSION 2.3.0
info:
Version 2.3.0: 2026-02-10
 - Changed some device identifiers to be compatible with ha-bambulab cards
 - Duplicated externalspool sensor to its own unique device
 - Updated filament library
 - Added initial H2D/C Support (NEED EXAMPLE DATA)
 - Updated object_id to default_entity_id
===
Version 2.1.7: 2024-10-23
 - Adjusted custom speed values
   - Reduced max from 180 to 166, same as ludicrous.
   - Adjusted extrapolation to be more accurate (thanks x1plus/jon), should help if it gave a weird sound at some speeds
 - Many sensors that used to report "None" or empty strings, now may report "No Data" or "Not Set" etc. Because HomeAssistant now treats string value "None" as "Unknown" ffs
 - Many other fixes here and there and cleanup
 - If custom gcode commands is enabled, added a select entity to trigger a move action for X,Y,Bed, and Extruder to preset relative values. After request, it will be set back to "None" or empty value.
===
Version 2.1.6: 2024-06-24
 - Improved cloud connection Logic
  - If the cloud mqtt is unstable, it will no longer enter into a reconnection loop regardless of stability issues
  - All nodes will be reset upon trying, so only one retry cycle can ever exist
 - MQTT client id's are now hard-set as "nodered_wws_SERIAL"

===
Version 2.1.5.1: 2024-06-24
 - Add in a force flag to mqtt connections, hopefully preventing in case for cloud users if it ever did not exit cleanly

===
Version 2.1.5: 2024-06-17
 - cleanup
 - slight changes to http requests to improve security
 - mini fix for end time and time remaining errors
 - support for upcoming X1Plus flow

===
Version 2.1.4: 2024-06-02
 - Added Print Error
   - This is a top-level print-halting error. The same one that sends push notifications and such.
 - Reorganized/cleaned up flow.
 - Added in function to check cloud-connectivity and status of printer when in cloud-only mqtt mode.

===
Version 2.1.3: 2024-05-15
- Added more queue data to ignored list for cleanup
- Added count of currently skipped objects in print
- Fix the print start time again
- Invert humidity level

===
Version 2.1.2: 2024-04-27
- Store subtask_id's and print name/filenames for up to 3 days to add extra checks in adv flow
- Added control for multiple print-options dependign on what's supported 
- Added future fix for missing print start time and possibly workaround for missing in P1 series

===
Version 2.1.1: 2024-04-10
- Added baseline speed_percent sensor
- Added custom speed percent control
  - Can adjust a custom speed percent modifier from 30 to 180%.
    - I initially had down to 10%, but values below 50 and above 166 tend to get weird and not easy to extrapolate.
    - 30-50 was okay in testing, above 166 not worth it but 180 seemed "okay" enough.
    - Done in steps of 2, as even numbers do math better
  - Will override speed modes
  - Setting speed mode will override custom value
  - Custom values may get rounded off to a slightly different percentage by printer (usually +-3ish)
  - If you match an exact speed percentage to a preset, it will instead call setting the preset, as values calculated are slightly different.
  - Thanks Jon!
- Add retaining for AMS ID's so dashboard yamls can always display them
- Fixed bed/nozzle set-target options from not having proper state linking to actual target temps
- More icon changes
- Made print preview image *only* exist if user has adv flow. Dashboard YAML now has it as conditional if available
- Added version check. It will only check basic and advanced flows (not bedmesh).
  - Sensors added for flow versions and flow status.

===
Version 2.1.0: 2024-03-13
- Add support for newer style of HMS errors
- X1Plus CFW info compatibility
- Reorganise and reduce MQTT subscriptions. Should help optimize flow a bit more.
- Made some state values retained and stored in flow
- Added an optional setting (default false) to allow sending arbitrary gcode to the printer
  - AT YOUR OWN RISK
  - To enable, go to "Set Flow Properties" and set "allow_gcode_control" to true.
  - This will create a text input sensor called "gcode command" in HA, enter in your gcode command here
  - Then, after it updates (give it a second or two), call the service or press the button "send gcode"
  - Highly recommend to set the gcode_command text to empty when done in your automation or other

===
Version 2.0.11: 2024-01-20
- Added Uptime sensor. counts updatime since nodered deploy/connected to printer.
- Converted start and end time to proper timestamp sensors!
- Misc fixes, typos

===
Version 2.0.10: 2023-12-30
- Updated filament dictionary
- Added A1 support
- Added Loop-Reconnect logic for cloud mqtt connections
- Misc edits

===
Version 2.0.9: 2023-12-11
- Added door sensor for X1 series (new firmware only)
- Added new stages
- Added some new sensor values found from printer

===
Version 2.0.8: 2023-11-05
- Added 10 new stages from Bambulabs
- Added sensor for whether the printer is connected to network via wired ethernet or wireless
- Added sensor for how the printer is homed
 - None, X, Y, Z, XY, XZ, YZ, XYZ
- Added SSDP*
 - If this does not work for you, you may need to open ports 2021 and 1990 from your nodered instance to the host machine. This will depend on firewalls, network type, deployment type etc. It is non-critical at this stage though.
 - This is *not* used for discovery, but rather to augment existing data
 - For example, getting IP address, Real model info, Series info, Dev name, etc.
 - This unfortunately does not make it possible for me to make a single flow work for multiple printers, as the mqtt nodes for both the printer in/out and homeassistant in can only be to one IP at a time.
   - There might be some possible way, but it'll be in the far future
- Added chamber target temperature setting WIP, waiting for X1E
- Added target temps as standalone sensors, to avoid people relying on attributes for automations
- Added new diagnostic sensors
- Experimental A1 Mini support
- Experimental X1E support

===
Version 2.0.7: 2023-10-06
- Misc fixes and version sync for adv flow

===
Version 2.0.6: 2023-09-19
- Misc fixes and code cleanup
- Parity for Adv flow

===
Version 2.0.5: 2023-09-11
- Fix for start time being invalid for a few seconds
- Fixed method to initiate a pushall request on print start
===
Version 2.0.4: 2023-09-09

- Misc bug fixes (minor)
- Added parsing for AMS Status and AMS RFID Status
- Added debug capability for full print message if set to temperature
- Logic to help support plate id for advanced flow in edge case of P1 series not working

===
Version 2.0.3: 2023-08-20
- Added plate_name sensor to support advanced flow changes and P1 series

===
Version 2.0.2: 2023-08-19
- Fixed several bugs regarding start time
- Fixed issues regarding print real Action
- Fixed minor bugs surrounding HMS errors not resetting to 0
- Changed HMS error attributes format
- Separated HMS notifications to be separate sensors per severity level (unknown, info, common, and then serious and fatal). Existing automations will have the "sum" of all HMS messages as expected before.
- Provided failsafe for if the PING command is killed for unknown reasons resulting in it not being "reachable", when ping next succeeds it will shortly force a reset - MQTT stays connected during this, so only a momentary notice of "offline". If you have any automations depending on the printer suddenly going offline, please make sure it's offline for at least 60 seconds continuously to be sure.
- Fixed bug where changing or setting fan speeds was not working anymore
- Fixed HMS description lookup

===
Version 2.0.1: 2023-08-07
- Minor bug fixes for Set Nozzle/Bed Temperature not working
- Bug fix for nozzle or bed temp sometimes being unavailable when a target temperature is set

===
Version 2.0.0: 2023-08-06
- Reset version - Very soon it will be moved from gists into a repository instead, with its own github pages to configure off of my site if desired.
- Some cleanup
- Added a "State Change" select - THIS DOES NOT LET YOU CHANGE STATE. It is purely to auto add the device triggers for print stage, since MQTT Device Trigger does not let me supply a list of values for a custom one.
    - Note: Stage is very unreliable now with recent firmware and should not be depended on for automations. It is left for older firmwares or if BBL makes it reliable again.
    - If you want an automation to turn off lights during calibration steps, make it look for print status = RUNNING and layer = 0. Once layer = 1 or higher, it is equivalent to "printing" stage, but as 0 it is equiv to any calibration stage
- Did the same for a "Print Status Change" select. Setting an option for it does nothing! Just used for automation triggers with prefilled values.
- Added button to force FTP fetch if exists in flow
- Added more error handling regarding MQTT connections (Printer + Your output such as HA). Separated into connection of MQTT to printer and if printer ip is reachable on network via ping. This should present any issues of either MQTT being disconnected when both are online as it will retry on several timers now - unless your IPs have changed.
- Added some additional controls for toggling video (not timelapse!!!) (only when camera exists)
- Added Parsing for Print-Real_Action as Print Action. This uses the same IDs as current stage, however it's limited to just stages during printing, such as printing, pause, etc. I also manually inject idle if stg_cur comes back as idle (this is the only reliable stg_cur btw)
- Added Camera Resolution setting - will only show up after some camera messages populate in. If it shows up but as unavailable, wait 5 minutes or press the reset filter button.
- Added a few flow-based values to override certain settings based on received data - necessary for new firmwares.
- Added a bunch of warning and error messages depending on present flows, invalid stuff, etc. Some are ignorable and will be prefixed as [Ignorable]. Please ignore these if you understand the context a bit.

===
Rev 48: 2023-05-01
- Changed the p1p cloud mqtt connection, even though it should not ever be used except for one older firmware

===
Rev 46/47: 2023-05-01
- Removing MQTT configs to be external nodes passing in, so importing multiple flows and updating are easier
- Added a reconnect for when printer comes online with new mqtt flow. Shouldn't be necessary but added as a backup
- When HA connects in MQTT now, it will reset the filter so no more waiting 5m on setup. Hopefully

===
Rev 45: 2023-04-29
- Added Filament Unload button which runs the built in unload procedure

===
Rev 42: 2023-04-27
- Added sensor for storing the last Pressure Advance value from LIDAR calibration for 24 hours

===
Rev 40/41: 2023-04-27
- Whoops forgot to change this for 40
- Added new button to "clear" external spool

===
Rev 39: 2023-04-26
- Add support for plate_type sensor (only filled out by advanced flow with FTP)
- Support for newest firmware release of X1C 01.05.01.00 (20230426)
- VT_Tray already implemented for P1P, but renamed to External Spool now.

===
Rev 36: 2023-04-07
- Changed logic of the global connected status to be ping-based
Every 30s we will ping the printer to check if it's online or not.
This is because the MQTT will be online if P1P cloud mode, even if printer is not.


===
Rev 35: 2023-04-05
- Added in workaround for allowing P1P to connect using Cloud mode
This requires an additional setup flow to set a global attribute
And requires a local flow boolean for P1P_CLOUD_MODE

====
Rev 34: 2023-03-14
- Added fan speed controls for Chamber, Part and Aux fans.
- Heatbreak fan is read only currently.

====
Rev 33: 2023-03-11

- Fixed EndTime continuing to increment after print ended
- In progress but not yet activated placeholders for camera entities

====
Rev 31: 2023-03-05

- Added default icons to some more sensors
- Added Number Boxes to set Bed and Nozzle Temps within ranges (0-100 bed, 0-300 nozzle)
- General update for syncing

====
Rev 30: 2023-02-25

Changed a bit how filament fetching works.
Now it will be unknown, none or the sensor unavailable depending on "how" it can't get the filament type in use.
This is such that the advanced flow fetching filament type can work better
(i.e., when it's unavailable here, then filament fetch will work)

IT IS OKAY if the filament sensor is not working fully, that's expected due to limitations.

====
Rev 29: 2023-02-23

Fixed: Issue with a junction not being in the group of the last update

Added: 
    - Button to turn on and off nozzle light.

====
Rev 28: 2023-02-23

Added:
    - New Filament Sensor. This will attempt to get the *type* of filament in use. Really only works for AMS users. Don't worry if it doesn't show up or is unavailable, it just means it can't make a default one and is not considered an error - I just have no way of handling / finding out.
    - New buttons to turn on or off the Logo Light via GCODE - these are buttons and not a light or switch, as I cannot poll for the light status.
 I also from now on will not be including the flow page in the exports, but JUST the group, this should make importing easier for replacement.

name: split

Error Handling
info:
The purpose of this group is to catch "ok" errors

This way, when troubleshooting, there is no multi-day rabbit hole looking into
error that are OK to have no matter how many times I mention it :)

rules.v: Error: Disconnect from broker before connecting

name: Throw Error
func:
node.error(msg.error.source.name + "  \n" + msg.error.message);
node.error(msg);
